page.title: 03THE HISTORY OF NOMANSLAND
page.content:
For over 40 years the chapel has been a religious part of the village.in 1848 services took place outside Boyces cottage on the green opposite his gate,but on wet days the old kitchen was provided to take the services in.It was very snug in the kitchen.The preacher would walk over from Romsey or Sway.
COTTAGES
In the 19th.cent.Houses had mudded or clay walls and thatched roofs.60 or 70 years ago men made mud and clay walls with their bare hands.The men found the clay from the village pond that was the first clay they found. SCHOOL
Before 1875 there wasn't a school in
